intro: Malleostemon pentagonus, commonly known as the five-angled malleostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
